# HawkSearch Developer Community Code of Conduct

## Our Pledge

We are committed to providing a welcoming, inclusive, and professional environment for everyone participating in the HawkSearch developer community. This includes contributors, maintainers, employees, partners, and community members engaging through GitHub repositories, issues, pull requests, discussions, and other collaboration spaces.

We aim to foster a community built on **respect, collaboration, and technical excellence**.

---

## Our Standards

### Positive behavior includes:
- Being respectful, considerate, and constructive
- Using welcoming and inclusive language
- Providing thoughtful, technically grounded feedback
- Focusing on what is best for the community and end users
- Gracefully accepting constructive criticism
- Helping others learn and succeed

### Unacceptable behavior includes:
- Harassment, discrimination, or personal attacks of any kind
- Trolling, insulting, or derogatory comments
- Publishing or requesting proprietary, confidential, or internal HawkSearch information
- Sharing API keys, credentials, or sensitive customer data
- Persistent off-topic discussions, spam, or self-promotion
- Treating community spaces as customer support channels
- Any conduct that would be inappropriate in a professional workplace

---

## Scope

This Code of Conduct applies to all community spaces managed under HawkSearch GitHub organizations, including:

- Repositories
- Issues and pull requests
- GitHub Discussions
- Community documentation and guides

It also applies to interactions that occur outside these spaces when they impact the community or its members.

---

## Proprietary Software Boundary

HawkSearch is a proprietary SaaS product.

Community repositories are intended for:
- Public API usage
- Examples, tools, and guides
- Best practices and architectural patterns

They are **not** intended for:
- Sharing internal HawkSearch source code
- Reverse engineering or disclosure of private systems
- Requests for undocumented or internal features

Content that violates these boundaries may be removed without notice.

---

## Enforcement Responsibilities

Community maintainers and HawkSearch staff are responsible for clarifying standards and taking appropriate action when behavior violates this Code of Conduct.

Possible enforcement actions include:
- Issuing a warning
- Editing or removing content
- Temporarily limiting participation
- Permanently banning users from community spaces

Enforcement decisions are made at the discretion of the HawkSearch maintainers.

---

## Reporting Issues

If you experience or witness behavior that violates this Code of Conduct, please report it by contacting:

**Email:** developer-relations@hawksearch.com

All reports will be reviewed promptly and handled confidentially.

---

## Enforcement Guidelines

Maintainers will follow these principles when responding to violations:
- Proportional response
- Consistency across cases
- Transparency where appropriate
- Respect for privacy and confidentiality

---

## Attribution

This Code of Conduct is inspired by the [Contributor Covenant](https://www.contributor-covenant.org/) and adapted for HawkSearch’s developer ecosystem.

---

## Final Note

This community exists to help developers succeed with HawkSearch.

Professionalism, mutual respect, and good-faith collaboration are expected from everyone.

Thank you for helping make the HawkSearch developer community a great place to build. 🚀
